column3: ACK. We've had periodic bouts of complaints on IRC (and github issues) from a mix of broken/trouble making nodes and also people just getting confused when the data is days stale due to long lived connections.\n

Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/aa250f0453029afbf3c903899a3770c61e389468 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
I'm sure I'm going to miss this sometimes, but I have no strong pro or con feeling...\n

@Diapolo Yes, having the information in some form would still be useful, hence my proposal #4133. It would show the reported height per peer, so that people can make their own conclusions and see what the source of the information is.\n
Untested ACK although I'd like to see a better `GetTotalBlocksEstimate()` function so we can display an estimate for the total number of blocks.\n
Print the progress % instead? Perhaps in a different PR.\n
Could be, though we already have a progress in % in the progress bar itself, so it wouldn't add much.\n
Huh it appears that it doesn't anymore. We used to have a percentage display at some point. Now we only show how far we're behind. Oh well.\n
